top_comment.text:
Hi Bold Bakers! This week, I'm teaming up with other great YouTube Channels 
to bring you the Ultimate Thanksgiving Guide. My contribution to this 
collaboration is a trio of BIG, BOLD & easy to make Holiday Pies: Fudge 
Pecan, Apple & Cranberry & Maple Pumpkin. So let's get baking!﻿

top_comment.text:
Easily create your own *Holiday Pies: Maple Pumpkin, Apple & Cranberry & 
Fudge Pecan* and go *BIG & BOLD* this holiday. Plus, watch an entire 
playlist of great Thanksgiving recipes so you can make the perfect holiday 
meal. Enjoy!

*Gemma's 3 Holiday Pies & Ultimate Thanksgiving Guide*
*CLICK LINK below to WATCH the entire playlist*
http://bit.ly/gemmasholidaypies
#bakingrecipe   #pumpkinpie   #applepie   #pecanpie  ﻿
top_comment.author: Gemma Stafford

video. :)

top_comment.text:

the recipe that indicate 1 cup of butter... and I now that I would eat more 
that just one slice.. u.u﻿

comments.text: Good idea
comments.author: Cecilia Ramirez L

comments.text:

When you have a sweet tooth take out a slice and enjoy. you won't feel the 
urge to eat it all at once then :)
comments.author: Gemma Stafford

captions.text: (Music)

Gemma's Bigger Bolder Baking
3 Holiday Pies

Hi Bold Bakers! Thanksgiving is almost here
so I'm really excited to team up with other

great YouTube channels to bring you the Ultimate
Thanksgiving Guide. My contribution to this

collaboration is a BIG & BOLD twist on holiday
pies: Pecan Fudge, Apple & Cranberry &
Maple Pumpkin. So let's get baking!

The pastry that I'm using for my holiday pies
is a sweet pastry that I've made before in

a previous video for Lemon Meringue Pie. It
makes a beautiful pastry. It's lovely and

crumbly and it freezes really well. So make
sure you check out that video.

We're going to kick off our holiday pies with
our Fudge Pie.

To make the fudge filling, we're going to
gently melt the chocolate and butter in a

heatproof bowl. You can do this gently in
the microwave, at 30 second intervals. Or

you can do it over a bain-marie. Just make
sure you do it nice and slow.

Now to our melted chocolate and butter, we're
going to add in our brown sugar. Then mix

these all together. To this we're going to
add in our flour, salt and vanilla extract.

And then gently mix together. Now add in your
room temperature eggs and whisk them in well.

As you're mixing it, you'll start to see this
fudge mix is actually just like a gorgeous
brownie and it smells like one too.

To prepare your pie shell, I have lined a
9 inch tin and as you can see mine is nice

and deep because I like all of that filling.
With your pastry, you want it to hang over

the lip because sometimes pastry has the tendency
to shrink. And if it does, you won't notice

it if you have a little bit of extra pastry
to work with. To create a fancy rim for your

pecan pie, we are going to put our fingers
on either side of the pastry, finger-width

apart, and then pull a little bit of pastry.
Keep going the whole way around the pie dish.

Once you get the hang of it, it's really quick
and easy and you can do it on any pie. There

you have it, an easy and beautiful way to
decorate the crust of a pie so yours will

stand out on Thanksgiving Day. I also like
to dock the base of my pie with a fork just

so no air bubbles form. You get the best results
from your pastry when it's nice and cold,

so put this guy in the fridge until you're
ready to fill it.

Now pour in your lovely fudge filling into
your prepared pie crust. I feel like during

Thanksgiving, sometimes chocolate gets overlooked
so I wanted to make sure I got a nice chocolate
pie in there.

For the pecan part of this pie, you're simply
going to lay toasted pecans all around the

surface of the fudge giving lovely flavor
and texture. And this pie is a really lovely

twist on a traditional pecan pie. Before your
pie goes in the oven, we're going to brush

it with egg wash to give the pastry a lovely
golden brown color.

We're going to bake this pie off at 350 degrees.
Now I don't put it on a baking tray because

I want to get that direct heat from the bottom
to give it a beautiful golden brown underneath.

Our fudge pie is done. It smells rich and
chocolatey. But we have to let this cool and

then at the end of the video I'll show you
what is inside.
Now let's get started on our Apple & Cranberry.

To make the Apple & Cranberry filling, you're
going to start out by peeling and chopping

your apples. I like to chop the apples really
small so it cooks down well. To our chopped

apples, we're going to add in our cranberries.
You can use fresh or frozen; they're both

really good. And if you don't like cranberries,
or you can't get ahold of them you can just

use all apples or you can add in a different
fruit.

To this we're going to add in our brown sugar.
Brown sugar pairs really well with apples

because it kind of makes them taste a little
caramelly. Add in some vanilla extract. Lastly,

we're going to add in some corn starch. And
then mix all these lovely flavors together.

The corn starch thickens the juices in your
pie and it actually creates a really lovely

thick sauce. To fill your Apple & Cranberry
pie, simply put your lovely filling into your

prepared pie dish. For our Apple pie, we're
actually going to put another layer of pastry

on top so make sure to egg wash the rim of
your pie shell just so the other layer will

stick to it. To create a BIG & BOLD crust for
our Apple & Cranberry Pie, use seasonal cutters

to create shapes from your dough. It just
adds a really nice extra effect to the top

of your pie and makes it really unique. Then
take the lovely pastry layer you created and

place it gently on top. Then go around the
rim and pierce the edges together with your

fingers. Take a knife and trim away any excess
pastry around the edges to give you a nice

round finished pie. To make sure your pastry
is sealed together, I like to take a butter

knife and then just press the two layers together.
It seals them well and creates a really nice
shape and finish.

This pie is gorgeous. Now we have to egg wash
it to give it a lovely golden brown color

when it's baked. Now just in case you have
any little rips in your pastry or it doesn't

look totally round, don't worry about it.
You're going to take the little apples that

we cut out from our pastry and then just put
them on any little funny spots. Just make

sure you egg wash before you put them down
so they stick. We're going to bake this pie

off at 350 degrees until it's lovely golden
brown and bubbling. Our apple pie is done and
it looks gorgeous. But we can't stop here.

I'm going BIG & BOLD for the holiday season,
so if you like this recipe and want to see

more then don't forget to subscribe to my
channel.

Ok so let's get started on making our maple
and pumpkin pie. In a large bowl, we're going

to add our eggs, pumpkin, evaporated milk,
sugar, maple syrup, pumpkin pie spice and salt.

And then just whisk all these together.
It is that simple.

Just like the other pies, we're going to pour
our filling into our prepared pie tin.

This pie combines two of my favorite flavors for
the holidays: pumpkin and maple. Now just

like the others, we're going to give this
pie a BIG & BOLD crust. Egg wash the edges

of your pastry shell. Now similar to the apple,
I cut out some maple leaves, some acorns,

some holly: just really seasonal things. And
we're going to lay them around the edge of

this pie. I love adding decorations to the
crust because not only does it make your pie
look great it just covers up any imperfections.

We're going to bake this pie at 400 degrees
for 15 minutes and then you're going to turn

down the oven to 350 and continue cooking.
And then you'll have a beautiful homemade Pumpkin Pie.

Now, of course, the proof is in the pudding
so let's cut open one of these pies.

Oh, man. That is gorgeous! This is perfectly
cooked. Still really moist. Kind of like a brownie.
You've got really great texture.

And, of course, I'm going to recommend serving
these pies with my No Machine Homemade Ice Cream.

Just look at how fudgie this is: it's like
the best brownie ever but it's a holiday pie.

Now you have a pie to satisfy anyone's taste
this holiday season.

I hope you all have a fantastic Thanksgiving.
And make sure you watch all the other great

videos in this playlist. Don't forget to subscribe
to my channel and I'll see you back here again
next Thursday for more Bigger Bolder Baking.

title: 3 Homemade Pies (Pumpkin, Apple, Pecan Fudge) - Gemma's Bigger Bolder Baking
